name: unenterprising
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not good at thinking of and doing new and difficult things, especially things that will make money: He was lazy and unenterprising, and expected jobs to just fly in through the window. London can be the loneliest place on earth if you are too shy or too unenterprising to make friends. Compare
enterprising
More examplesFewer examplesHe regarded them as being unenterprising and incapable of advancement.Everyone was on a fiddle of some sort and those who were not were simply too dumb or unenterprising to find one.I look forward to discovering what our unenterprising minister will glean in his short trip.
